009package Edge_Preserving_Smoothing;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
013import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015import imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving.PeronaMalikFilterScalar;
016import imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving.PeronaMalikFilterVector;
017import imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving.PeronaMalikF.ColorMode;
018import imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving.PeronaMalikF.Parameters;
019import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilter;
020
021/**
022 * Minimal plugin to demonstrate the use of the PeronaMalikFilter class.
023 * This plugin works for all types of images and stacks.
024 * 
025 * @author W. Burger
026 * @version 2022/03/30
027 * 
028 * @see PeronaMalikFilterScalar
029 * @see PeronaMalikFilterVector
030 * @see GenericFilter
031 */
032public class Perona_Malik_Demo implements PlugInFilter {
033
034        public int setup(String arg0, ImagePlus imp) {
035                return DOES_ALL;
036        }
037
038        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
039                
040                // create a parameter object, modify settings if needed:
041                Parameters params = new Parameters();
042                params.iterations = 20;
043                params.alpha = 0.15;
044                params.kappa = 20.0;
045                params.colorMode = ColorMode.ColorGradient;
046
047                // create the actual filter:
048                GenericFilter filter = (ip instanceof ColorProcessor) ?
049                        new PeronaMalikFilterVector(params) :
050                        new PeronaMalikFilterScalar(params);
051                
052                // apply the filter:
053                filter.applyTo(ip);
054        }
055        
056}
057
058
